title: Ted Gehring
text:
Theodore Edwin Gehring Jr. (April 6, 1929 – September 28, 2000) was an American film and television actor. He is known for playing the recurring role as "Charlie" on 16 episodes of the American sitcom television series "<a href="Alice%20%28American%20TV%20series%29">Alice</a>".
Life and career.
Gehring was born in <a href="Bisbee%2C%20Arizona">Bisbee, Arizona</a>. Gehring began his career in 1965, where he first appeared in "<a href="The%20Big%20Valley">The Big Valley</a>", playing the role of "Larsh". He continued his career, mainly appearing in film and television, often cast as a policeman, bad guy or anonymous roles, over the years.
Later in his career, Gehring guest-starred in numerous television programs, including, "<a href="Gunsmoke">Gunsmoke</a>", "<a href="Battlestar%20Galactica%20%281978%20TV%20series%29">Battlestar Galactica</a>" (and its spin-off "<a href="Galactica%201980">Galactica 1980</a>"), "<a href="M%2AA%2AS%2AH%20%28TV%20series%29">M*A*S*H</a>", ', "<a href="Get%20Smart">Get Smart</a>", "<a href="Bonanza">Bonanza</a>", "<a href="The%20Rockford%20Files">The Rockford Files</a>", "<a href="Three%27s%20Company">Three's Company</a>", "<a href="Emergency%21">Emergency!</a>", "<a href="Little%20House%20on%20the%20Prairie%20%28TV%20series%29">Little House on the Prairie</a>", "<a href="Quincy%2C%20M.E.">Quincy, M.E.</a>", "<a href="Daniel%20Boone%20%281964%20TV%20series%29">Daniel Boone</a>", "<a href="Death%20Valley%20Days">Death Valley Days</a>", "<a href="Adam-12">Adam-12</a>" and '. He also appeared in films, such as, "<a href="The%20Best%20Little%20Whorehouse%20in%20Texas%20%28film%29">The Best Little Whorehouse in Texas</a>", "<a href="Nickelodeon%20%28film%29">Nickelodeon</a>", "<a href="Bound%20for%20Glory%20%281976%20film%29">Bound for Glory</a>", "<a href="The%20Apple%20Dumpling%20Gang%20Rides%20Again">The Apple Dumpling Gang Rides Again</a>", "<a href="When%20Time%20Ran%20Out...">When Time Ran Out...</a>", "<a href="The%20Legend%20of%20the%20Lone%20Ranger">The Legend of the Lone Ranger</a>", "<a href="The%20Domino%20Principle">The Domino Principle</a>" and "<a href="Rafferty%20and%20the%20Gold%20Dust%20Twins">Rafferty and the Gold Dust Twins</a>". Gehring has also played the role as "Sydney Forbes" in the <a href="soap%20opera">soap opera</a> television series "<a href="Days%20of%20Our%20Lives">Days of Our Lives</a>", from 1980.
Gehring also starred and co-starred in other films and television programs, as it includes, "<a href="The%20Family%20Holvak%20%28TV%20series%29">The Family Holvak</a>", playing the role of "Chester Purdle", "<a href="The%20Mad%20Bomber%20%28film%29">The Police Connection</a>", playing the role of "Police Chief Marc C. Forester" and "<a href="On%20the%20Air%20Live%20with%20Captain%20Midnight">On the Air Live with Captain Midnight</a>", playing the role of "Father". His last film appearance, was from the <a href="television%20film">television film</a> "Leave Her to Heaven", in 1988. In 1989, Gehring retired his career in film and television, last appearing in the television series "<a href="1st%20%26amp%3B%20Ten%20%281984%20TV%20series%29">1st & Ten</a>", where he played the recurring role as "Ned Lassiter".
Death.
Gehring died in September 2000 in <a href="Steelville%2C%20Missouri">Steelville, Missouri</a>, at the age of 71.
